titles.title: Yoroiden Samurai Troopers
Armor Legend Samurai Troopers
Ronin Warriors
魔神坛斗士
鎧伝サムライトルーパー
Legendary Armor Samurai Troopers
Les samouraïs de l`éternel
I Cinque Samurai
Samurai Warriors

anime.description: A group of five young men who have been gifted with mystical, superpowered samurai armor in order to fight against an otherworldly invasion from the "Phantom World," a dark dimension headed by the evil warlord Arago. Arago (who in his initial incarnation appears as a giant spectral, glowing helmet, and later grows to gigantic size) was originally vanquished centuries ago in his first invasion attempt by a holy man who later appears in the series to counsel the heroes. Arago`s henchmen also wear mystical armor, each with different weapons and a different specialty. It is revealed later in the series that both the heroes` and the villains` mystical armor are parts of the same ultra-powerful suit of armor that was broken up when Arago was originally defeated, creating an interesting good vs. evil dichotomy in the warriors` own arms and armor.

externalentity.identifier: 鎧伝サムライトルーパー

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ghost
tag.description: In traditional belief, a ghost is the soul or spirit of a deceased person or animal that can appear, in visible form or other manifestation, to the living. Descriptions of the apparition of ghosts vary widely: The mode of manifestation can range from an invisible presence to translucent or wispy shapes, to realistic, life-like visions.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: world domination
tag.description: "Gee, Brain, what do you want to do tonight?" "The same thing we do every night, Pinky: try to take over the world!" A main objective for one of the characters is absolute control of not just one country, but a whole planet!

tag.name: fighting
tag.description: For some reason or other one faction has to take it out on some opponent via fight or battle. Typical examples of this are all the anime with "endless pointless fighting" tag.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Sanada Ryou
character.description: Sanada Ryou is the unofficial leader of the Ronin Warriors. He is often called "hot-headed" and does tend to charge ahead without putting too much thought into the situation beforehand. Nevertheless, he has a big heart and cares for his friends.

episode.title: ねらわれた大東京
Shadowland
Menace sur la Terre
Il mondo in pericolo
Nerawareta Dai Tokyo
episode.summary: Dark omens herald the re-awakening of Arago, the ruler of the netherworld. But where the Empire of Doom appears, so too shall the Samurai Troopers! Ryo is joined by Toma, Shu, Shin, and Seiji, and wearing their legendary armor, they battle against the first soldier of doom to appear in Tokyo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻魔将, 螺呪羅の策略
Friend or Foe
Illusions, illusions...
Genmashou, Rajura no Sakuryaku
episode.summary: Only Toma of the Heavens remains, but his location is a mystery. The Warlord of Illusions, Rajura, attacks the Troopers, all to lure them to a lake where Toma is supposedly held. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開眼! 必殺の雷光斬
Splitting the Stone
Au cœur de la pierre
Kaigan! Hissatsu no Raikouzan
episode.summary: As Ryo deals with the Naruto Strait, Seiji and Nasté travel to the tallest peak in Hokkaido to find Shu. But when Anubis, the Warlord of Darkness strikes, Seiji must listen to the words of the Troopers` mysterious benefactor to learn the Lightning Strike. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反撃, 怒りの超流破
The Counter Attack
L`alliance de l`eau et du feu
Hangeki, Ikari no Chouryuuha
episode.summary: Seiji has been revived, but the other three Samurai Troopers have yet to be found. The group splits up, with Ryo and Jun attempting to revive Shin at the bottom of the Naruto Strait. But the Empire of Doom isn`t about to sit idly by. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活! 光の戦士
Halo`s Prison
Que la lumière soit
Fukkatsu! Hikari no Senshi
episode.summary: Ryo and the others arrive at the Caves of Autumn, where Nasté believes Seiji lies sleeping. However, to reach that glittering light, Ryo will need to face the darkness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 毒魔将那唖挫の罠
The Search Begins
Le piège
Dokumashou Naaza no Wana
episode.summary: Nasté takes Ryo to see her grandfather at the university in order to begin searching for the other Troopers. However, the Warlord of Venom, Naaza, has other plans for Ryo! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鎧擬亜, 烈火の秘密
Secret of Wildfire
Le retour de Ryo
Yoroigear, Rekka no Himitsu
episode.summary: Arago`s power of doom has scattered the Troopers. White Blaze leads Nasté and Jun to Mount Fuji, where Ryo awakens. Unfortunately, Shiten is follows right behind, intent on settling the score. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼魔将! 朱天の猛攻
Glory for Anubis
Première victoire
Demon all`attacco
Onimashou! Shuuten no Moukou
episode.summary: The modern weapons of the world are useless against the Empire of Doom. Shiten, the Warlord of Demons, steps forward to eliminate the only threat to the Empire--the Samurai Troopers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 烈火, 天空をすくえ
Wildfire in the Sky
Les esprits maléfiques
Rekka, Tenkuu o Sukue
episode.summary: Ryo and Shu race ahead to Tokyo to see what Arago and the Empire of Doom are up to. There, they witness a strange ball of dark energy pointed into space, ready to destroy Toma! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: セイジ! 暗闇の死闘
Shallow Darkness
Un éclair dans les ténèbres
Seiji! Kurayami no Shitou
episode.summary: As the Troopers make their way towards Arago`s castle, the forces of Doom spring a trap upon them, scattering them and driving them underground. In that darkness, Seiji must protect Jun and Nasté from Anubis. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妖邪門を打ち破れ
Assault on the Dynasty
Un pas en avant
Youjamon o Uchiyabure
episode.summary: All five Samurai Troopers are united, and now they stand ready to face Arago at his castle! However, to get there, they`ll need to step through the gates of the netherworld, and right into Rajura`s trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 集結! 5人の戦士
In the Sea of the Sky
Enfin réunis
Shuuketsu! 5-nin no Senshi
episode.summary: The fireball shot from the Cannon of Doom races towards Toma, with Ryo on board. Meanwhile, Shiten has a crisis of conscience, hinting at a hidden secret behind the armors. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヨロイギアの正体
Fate of the Ronin Armor
Le doute
Yoroigear no Shoutai
episode.summary: The city itself, under Arago`s control, serves to keep the Troopers split apart. Shu is targeted by Rajura and Arago, and the secret of the armor is revealed, much to Shu`s displeasure. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シュテン, 心なき戦い
Armor of Life
Le grand combat de Zebuth
Shuten, Kokoro Naki Tatakai
episode.summary: The Troopers are reunited, but only physically. Shu`s doubts come to the fore as Shiten, now consumed by his armor, battles against the Troopers with overwhelming power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カオス, 宿命の対決
The Ancient`s Battle
Le sacrifice de Kaos
Kaos, Shukumei no Taiketsu
episode.summary: Kaos reveals himself, and explains to Shiten the truth of his armor--of all the armors, and of Arago`s interest in them. The Troopers then seek a way into Arago`s castle, but the only way requires sacrifice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 突入, アラゴ城
Raid on Talpa`s Castle
L`attaque du palais
Totsunyuu, Arago-jou
episode.summary: The Troopers enter Arago`s castle proper, and are immediately confronted by the remaining three Warlords, who have received immense power from the netherworld! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: よみがえれ, 鎧戦士達よ...
The Warriors Return
Le dernier des samouraïs (2)
Yomigaere, Yoroi Senshi-tachi yo...
episode.summary: Even with Shiten, Nasté, and Jun, who holds the Jewel of Life, assisting Ryo and Toma, the forces of doom led by Kayura are relentless. However, there are secrets yet to be revealed about Kayura, as well as the Jewel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怒れ金剛, 砂妖邪をくだけ
Sand Blasted
La leçon
Ikare Kongou, Suna Youja o Kudake
episode.summary: Shu travels to Mt. Daisetsu. There, Rajura and the Sand Demons await him, with a plan to make the Trooper of Stone hesitate at his own destructive power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! カユラ対輝煌帝
Cheap Tricks
Un mystère de plus
Kessen! Kayura Tai Kikoutei
episode.summary: Reunited once more, the Samurai Troopers face off against Kayura and the Three Warlords. However, as Ryo brings the Inferno Armor`s power to bear on Kayura, someone intervenes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白炎命をかけた戦い
White Blaze`s Sacrifice
Le grand combat de Kraor
Byakuen Inochi o Kaketa Tatakai
episode.summary: Even with the white armor, if Ryo doesn`t have a sword, he can`t beat Kenbukyo in a duel. Despite heavy wounds, White Blaze makes a sacrifice to help Ryo along. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 輝け白き鎧!
Ryo`s Mega Armor
L`éclat de l`armure
Kagayake Shiroki Yoroi!
episode.summary: Worried over the nature of the white armor, Ryo distances himself from his friends. However, Saranbou isn`t about to wait to claim his prize, and lures Ryo into a trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 輝け! 五人の戦士達
Triumphant Warriors
La défaite du mal
Kagayake! Gonin no Senshi-tachi
episode.summary: It`s the final battle, and the Samurai Troopers are ready to face Arago head on! As the netherworld seeps into the mortal world, what will it take to stop Arago once and for all? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妖邪帝王の使者
Sun Devil: Ambassador of Evil
L`envoyé d`Arkatakor
Youja Teiou no Shisha
episode.summary: Ryo restores the Swords of the Wildfire, just in time for a new threat to emerge from the netherworld. Kokuyoen is an aggressive foe, and he`s come on behalf of his master to test the white armor! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地霊衆, 恐怖の作戦
Strategies of the Nether World
Un plan démoniaque
Chireishuu, Kyoufu no Sakusen
episode.summary: Badamon has a plan to deliver the Inferno Armor to Arago, and he needs Lady Kayura`s help. However, the Three Warlords have grown jealous of Kayura, and when the trap is set, things don`t go as planned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カユラ! 聖なる目覚め
Lady Evil Sees the Light
Tous contre Arkatakor
Kayura! Seinaru Mezame
episode.summary: The Samurai Troopers have been taken, and the Three Warlords are right behind them. Shiten alone remains to fight the Badamon-possessed Kayura, and no matter what, Kaos`s will shall be done! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣舞卿の挑戦
Saber Stryke`s Deadly Challenge
Le défi de Spadassor
Kenbukyou no Chousen
episode.summary: The Swords of Wildfire have been damaged, unable to bear the power of the white armor. Searching out the more powerful Swords of Fervor, the Troopers are met with a demon calling himself Kenbukyo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ここは妖邪界か?
Talpa Turns the Tide
Le monde du mal
Koko wa Youja-kai ka?
episode.summary: Shiten explains to Nasté and Jun how he came to be both the Warlord of Demons and the wielder of Kaos`s staff. Meanwhile, Ryo and Toma have entered the netherworld, and face off against an entire army. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決! 二人の水滸
Torrent`s Evil Twin
Le doute général
Taiketsu! Futari no Suiko
episode.summary: Disturbed over the power the Swords of Fervor draw out of the white armor, the Samurai Troopers split up to train their hearts and minds. Unfortunately, while they`re separated, an old enemy reappears, targeting Shin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなる戦い
Ronin vs. Saranbo
La nouvelle bataille
Aratanaru Tatakai
episode.summary: Arago is defeated, but while the Troopers rest, another threat stirs. Saranbou, desiring to be the new ruler of the netherworld, attempts to take the white armor that defeated Arago for himself! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光輪よ, 光をとりもどせ
The Armor Must Be Destroyed
Duel dans la nature
Kourin yo, Hikari o Torimodose
episode.summary: Concerned over his armor`s potentially corrupting effects, Seiji returns to where his armor was revived, so long ago. But Arago continues to capitalize on the scattered Troopers, and sends forth Anubis. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説の鎧, 輝煌帝
Legend of the White Armor
L`armure légendaire
Densetsu no Yoroi, Kikoutei
episode.summary: Dala, wielding a sword charged with the power of Nimbus, Stone, and Torrent, battles against Ryo and Toma. Meanwhile, Badamon, lord of the nether spirits, reveals the true nature of the white armor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 行け! 二人の戦士達よ...
Anubis Is Reborn
Plus que deux
Ike! Futari no Senshi-tachi yo...
episode.summary: Ryo and Toma learn the true identity behind "Kaos," who cautions them against falling into Lady Kayura`s trap. Regardless, the two must go, if they`re to rescue their friends. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎の女妖邪カユラ出現
Lady Kayura and the Dark Realm
La mystérieuse Karyura
Nazo no Onna Youja Kayura Shutsugen
episode.summary: Lady Kayura, an overwhelmingly powerful demon from the netherworld, appears and mocks Toma and Ryo over the capture of Seiji, Shin, and Shu. During the battle to lure the remaining two Troopers into the netherworld, a certain staff appears. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎の秘宝を求めて
In Search of Secret Treasures
Le trésor secret
Nazo no Hihou o Motomete
episode.summary: Searching for information, Nasté discovers references to a Jewel of Life, said to be the key to destroying the netherworld once and for all. The forces of doom overhear this, and refuse to sit idly by. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活の紅雷閃
Anubis` Armor Revived
Zebuth retrouve son armure
Fukkatsu Kouraisen
episode.summary: Shiten meditates over the connection between Kaos and Kayura. Meanwhile, with Kayura`s mind in turmoil, Badamon suggests a plan to end the threat of the Samurai Troopers once and for all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天空, 傷だらけの戦い
Strata`s Defiant Stand
Le dernier des samouraïs (1)
Tenkuu, Kizu Darake no Tatakai
episode.summary: Ryo and Toma attempt to sneak into the castle to rescue the other three Samurai Troopers. Unfortunately for them, another of Arago`s deadly traps lays in wait for them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖の妖邪帝王
Talpa`s Triumph
Le triomphe d`Arkatakor
Kyoufu no Youja Teiou
episode.summary: Arago has arisen with a massive, powerful body. Ryo faces off against him alone. Nasté and Jun seek out the source of Arago`s power, while Ryo struggles to find the answer to a cruel fate. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! 烈火対アラゴ
Wildfire`s Fight Against Fate
L`ultime victoire
Kessen! Rekka Tai Arago
episode.summary: As Ryo is absorbed into Arago, Kaos reveals the Emperor of Doom`s origins, and the final truth behind the armors. Ryo must fight, armed with Righteousness... and he isn`t alone! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明かされた鎧伝説
The Legend of the Armor
La fin des samouraïs
Akasareta Yoroi Densetsu
episode.summary: The Troopers launch an all-out assault on Arago himself. However, the truth behind their armors is revealed as Arago grows to unbelievable heights of power. Source: crunchyroll
